chunks.original_text: 底本出处：《万历续道藏》。 徐仙真录卷之二 真君琼科 入坛 人各序立，存神闭气，叩齿九通，咽液九过，步虚。 太极分高厚，轻清上属天。 人能修正道，身乃作真仙。 行溢三千数，时丁四万年。 丹台开宝笈，金口为流傅。 祝香 炉焚宝炷，烟散瑶空，结为云台，妆成法界。 恭焚道香、德香、无为香、无为清浄香、清浄自然香、妙洞真香、灵宝惠香、超三界香、三景真香，满琼楼玉殿，遍周天法界。 以今恭焚宝香，虔诚供养 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚纱感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君， 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静仲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君， 圣父齐王，忠武翊亮真君，圣母田氏，仁寿淑善仙妃，圣兄唐王、洪王、鄂王、广陵王，圣舅护国公、奉国公，圣婿武安侯、宁国侯，圣子保大侯，彰信侯，保信侯，保宁侯、武宁侯，圣侄昭德侯、安定侯、太宁侯，圣孙武昌侯、南昌侯列位公卿。 上清大洞经箓天机院、天枢院、雷霆省天文院、天录院，地府诸司承行官将，驱邪捉祟传符勑法，消灾度厄逐凶辟怪监坛护法，观察巡捕将军，太岁尊神，十二月将弟子，本命元辰星官，风雷雨部仙众，左、右丞相太宰，六部尚侍内府公卿，左、右注生注寿上宰，左、右司录司福上宰，左、右侍从通事舍人，百官庶司所属曹僚，列位公卿，左、右福录司所属二十四曹官，左、右引进仙官，三天贝阙崇仁养正英仙，敷灵弘济真人，灵威清江尊王，永安留守查元帅，武安留守边元帅，节度使左监门魏元帅，都统军使右监门赵元帅都监军使先锋刁元帅，各及部下精兵猛士，左右岳许二元帅，左右行宫侍御从宫，司录、司勋、司士、司书列位曹僚，司农、司稼、典丝、掌葛，列位曹僚，司市、掌货、考工、饬材列位曹僚，厨官、优官、伶官，天捷、神捷、人捷，掌卜、掌签、掌柸、掌鸾，传梦童子，神局节级，直殿、直符，香官，使者诸仙，坛越施主，才德名贤，本宫土地正神，诸里、诸庙，王侯弟子。 各人奉祀神祇，灵济宫合殿威灵，仗此真香，普同供养。 香乃玉英散景，紫气凝烟，香云密罗，径充九天。 当愿金童侍香，传言散花玉女，上闻真前，所启所愿，咸赐如言。 入意。 以今开坛启白：伏愿真慈，俯赐昭鉴。 稽首皈依，无极大道。 唱道 道场众等人，各运心皈命二一宝，一切念华夏。 三匝。 浄坛 至真惟浄，难临秽浊之乡。 尘境未清，曷启玄元之范。 须洒一枝之法水，顿消万里之妖氛。 九凤翱翔，吐焰烟而破秽。 五龙奋迅，降真炁以除邪。 庶俾皈依，悉臻咸应。 太上玄言，谨当持诵。 洞中玄虚云云。 摄魔屏秽天尊举步虚 曰五帅至帅前上香云云。 伏以大而化之，之谓圣。 圣而不可知之，之谓神。
chunks.translated_text:
**Record of the Immortal Xu, Scroll Two**
**Precepts of the Perfected Lords for Entering the Altar**

Upon entering the altar, each person shall take their place in order, preserve spirit and close the breath, knock the teeth nine times, swallow saliva nine times, and pace the void.

*The Supreme Ultimate divides high and deep,*
*Light and pure, it ascends to belong to Heaven.*
*If one cultivates the true Dao,*
*The body becomes a perfected immortal.*
*Deeds overflow the count of three thousand,*
*Time reaches forty thousand years.*
*The cinnabar terrace opens its treasure scrolls,*
*The golden mouth spreads its flowing transmission.*

**Prayer for Incense**
The censer burns with precious incense,
its smoke scattering through the jade heavens,
forming a cloud terrace,
adorned as the Dharma Realm.

Reverently, we burn the incense of the Dao, the incense of virtue, the incense of non-action, the pure incense of non-action, the naturally pure incense, the wondrous cavernous true incense, the numinous treasure bestowing incense, the incense transcending the Three Realms, and the true incense of the Three Luminaries. May it fill the jade halls of the Jasper Capital and pervade the Dharma Realm of the cosmos.

Today, we reverently burn this precious incense to offer in devotion to:
*The Great Immortal of the Golden Towers of the Nine Heavens, Illuminator of the Dao and Attainer of Virtue, Manifest Spirit of Universal Salvation, Pure and Subtle Cavernous Mystery, Void and Wondrous Responsive Compassionate Protector of the Nation and Shelterer of the People, Exalted Blessing and Vast Grace Perfected Lord;*
*The Supreme Immortal of the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens, Proclaimer of Transformation and Upholder of the Teachings, Radiant Spirit of Vast Salvation, Lofty and Serene, Profound and Wondrous Responsive Benevolent Assistant to the Nation and Protector of the People, Abundant Blessing and Vast Grace Perfected Lord;*
*The Sacred Father, King Qi, Loyal and Martial Illustrious Perfected Lord;*
*The Sacred Mother, Lady Tian, Benevolent and Longevous Virtuous Immortal Consort;*
*The Sacred Elder Brothers, King Tang, King Hong, King E, and King Guangling;*
*The Sacred Uncles, Duke of the Nation’s Protection and Duke of the Nation’s Service;*
*The Sacred Sons-in-Law, Marquis of Martial Peace and Marquis of Tranquil Nation;*
*The Sacred Sons, Marquis of Preserving Greatness, Marquis of Manifesting Trust, Marquis of Preserving Trust, Marquis of Preserving Peace, and Marquis of Martial Peace;*
*The Sacred Nephews, Marquis of Illustrious Virtue, Marquis of Peaceful Stability, and Marquis of Supreme Peace;*
*The Sacred Grandsons, Marquis of Martial Prosperity and Marquis of Southern Prosperity;*
*All the noble lords and ministers;*
*The Heavenly Mechanism Bureau of the Great Cavern Scriptures and Registers, the Heavenly Pivot Bureau, the Thunder Department’s Celestial Patterns Bureau, the Heavenly Records Bureau;*
*All the officials and generals of the Earthly Prisons who carry out decrees, drive away evil, seize malevolent spirits, transmit talismans, and command the Dharma;*
*Those who dispel disasters, deliver from calamities, expel misfortune, and ward off monstrosities;*
*The altar-monitoring and Dharma-protecting generals;*
*The inspecting and patrolling generals;*
*The Venerable Spirit of the Year Star;*
*The twelve monthly generals and disciples;*
*The star officials of one’s original destiny and life-spirit;*
*The immortals of the Wind and Thunder Departments;*
*The Left and Right Chief Ministers and Grand Stewards;*
*The ministers of the Six Ministries and the inner court nobles;*
*The Left and Right Supreme Stewards of Life-Recording and Longevity-Recording;*
*The Left and Right Supreme Stewards of the Bureau of Records and the Bureau of Blessings;*
*The Left and Right Attendants and Envoys;*
*The officials and subordinates of the Hundred Offices and various bureaus;*
*All the noble lords and ministers;*
*The officials of the twenty-four bureaus under the Left and Right Bureaus of Blessings;*
*The Left and Right Guiding Immortal Officials;*
*The Perfected Immortals of the Three Heavenly Cowrie Towers, Cultivators of Benevolence and Nurturers of Rectitude;*
*The True Persons of Spreading Numinous Power and Vast Salvation;*
*The Venerable King of Numinous Might and Clear Rivers;*
*The Marshal Yuan of Eternal Peace and the Guardian of the Capital;*
*The Marshal Yuan of Martial Peace and the Guardian of the Frontier;*
*The Marshal Wei, Left Supervisor of the Gate of Discipline;*
*The Marshal Zhao, Right Supervisor of the Gate of Discipline and Commander of the United Armies;*
*The Marshal Diao, Commander of the Vanguard;*
*All their valiant soldiers and fierce warriors;*
*The Left and Right Marshals Yue and Xu;*
*The attendants of the Left and Right Traveling Palaces;*
*The officials of the Bureaus of Records, Merit, Personnel, and Documents;*
*The officials of the Bureaus of Agriculture, Crops, Silk, and Hemp;*
*The officials of the Bureaus of Markets, Commerce, Crafts, and Materials;*
*The kitchen officials, entertainment officials, and musicians;*
*The celestial, divine, and human swift messengers;*
*The officials of divination, lots, cups, and phoenixes;*
*The dream-transmitting youths;*
*The spirit bureau officers;*
*The attendants of the hall and talisman;*
*The incense officials;*
*The envoys and various immortals;*
*The donors and patrons of the altar;*
*The virtuous and renowned;*
*The local earth gods of this palace;*
*The deities of all villages and temples;*
*The disciples of kings and marquises.*

May each person’s worshipped deities, the united numinous powers of the Lingji Palace, and the entire assembly of sacred presences rely upon this true incense in universal offering.

This incense is the scattered radiance of jade blossoms,
the purple qi congealing into smoke,
a fragrant cloud woven densely,
directly filling the Nine Heavens.

May it be that the golden lads attend the incense,
the jade maidens transmit words and scatter flowers,
ascending to the presence of the true ones.
Whatever is petitioned and whatever is wished,
may all be granted as spoken.
*May it enter the mind.*

Today, as we open the altar and make this declaration, we humbly pray that the true compassion may deign to bestow its luminous regard.
We bow our heads and take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao.

**Chanting the Dao**
All in the Daoist ritual assembly,
each directs their mind to take refuge in the Two and the One,
reciting all the blossoming hymns of the Central Land.
*Three circumambulations.*

**Purifying the Altar**
The utmost true is only pure;
how can it descend to defiled realms?
When the dusty world is not yet cleansed,
how can the mysterious and primordial be manifested?
It is necessary to sprinkle the Dharma water from a single branch,
instantly dispelling the demonic miasma for ten thousand miles.
The nine phoenixes soar, spitting flames to break impurity.
The five dragons surge, descending true qi to expel evil.
May all who take refuge attain response in full.

The supreme and mysterious words of the Most High shall now be reverently recited.
*Within the cavernous void, the clouds...*

*The Heavenly Worthy Who Subdues Demons and Shields from Impurity paces the void:*
The five marshals proceed to the marshal’s presence to offer incense...

We humbly submit:
To transform on a grand scale is called sageliness.
That which is sagely yet unknowable is called spirit.

chunks.original_text: 至圣无为，固以虚而善应。 敬神如在，凡有感以皆通。 既能所存者，诚当知厥鉴不远。 恭惟查、边、魏、赵、刁五大元帅，位尊五帅，勇冠三军。 舞干羽于两阶，受钺斧之大柄。 出将入相，兼全文武之材。 辅国安民，独任君民之寄。 雍雍在宫，肃肃在庙，赫赫厥声，濯濯厥灵。 妙矣难言，藏诸不怒。 举皆燕、赵之奇士，当如廉、兰之交欢。 惟一惟和，是信是使。 梯山航海，不远千里而来。 驾雾腾空，径御九天之为上。 今辰修－设酬恩祈福道场，今则坛场洁浄，科典将宣。 稽首投诚，一心向道。 将欲请迎真驾，必须俯露衷忱，特凭无帅以通传。 恭愿至真而降格，大舍慈悲之愿。 允俞关白之情，虔诚投拜。 举　按人各恭敬　举上香 志心初念上香，香至灵济宫，遍灵济宫，圣境成云盖。 供养 圣父齐王，忠武翊亮真君。 志心二念上香，香至灵济官，遍灵济宫，真境成宝盖。 供养 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君。 志心三捻上香，香至灵济宫，遍灵济宫，仙境成华盖。 供养 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 跪炉 道由心学，心假香传。 手执玉炉，心存九天。 真君下盼，仙佩临轩。 所令关启，径达九天。 举　各礼真人存念如法 五星咒五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 刊名玉简，录字帝房。 乘飙扇景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，和：上卫仙翁。 举　呜法鼓二十四通 发炉 太上五灵老君，召出臣等，身中三五，功曹左右，香官使者，侍香金童。 传言散花玉女、直日香官、功曹使者、三炁正神，速上关启 查边魏赵刁五大元帅，岳许二元帅，天丁力士、左右神官：臣今升坛法事，谨奉为入意修设酬恩祈福道坛，其诸诚恳，具载词状文。 以今法事，愿得正真生气，流入臣等身中，令臣所启之言，速达无上三 宝天君 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君、 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 圣前一。 具位某，与坛官众等，同诚上启 九天金阙。 圣位同前。 伏以勾龙能土，柱能谷，乃兴社稷之祠。 周人尚臭，商尚声，以通神明之德。 岂牺牲特为之血食，然苹蘩可荐於王公。 圣而不知，是谓之神。 神而能名，乃入於圣。 恭惟 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君、 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 正直为德，祸福动人。 潜地而地，潜天而天，莫测威灵之妙。 曰旸而旸，曰雨而雨，独专造化之权。 赫赫厥声，洋洋如在。 上佐斗真於北极，默参玄学於东华。 与道合真，惟神是守。 名登金阙，荣颁三四字之封。 职灿宝御，颇称三千行之数。 随机赴感，发誓度人。 既蒙覆育之恩，敢昧祈禳之典。 恭遇 法驾来降道场，或服仙佩之跄跄，八鸾 后唱。 或衣朝衣之济济，百骑前迎上下。 仙眷之森罗，左右灵官之拥卫。 迎真菲礼，德鉴芹忱。 无任勤拳之至，谨稽首再拜，奉迎真驭。 请圣 谨上请
chunks.translated_text:
The Most Sagely abides in non-action,
naturally responding with emptiness.
Revering the spirits as if present,
all that is felt is wholly communicated.
Since what is held in mind is thus,
know that their mirroring is not far.

We humbly invoke the Five Great Marshals—Zha, Bian, Wei, Zhao, and Diao—
whose rank surpasses the five marshals,
whose valor leads the three armies.
They dance with shields and feathers between the two steps,
wielding the great axe of authority.
As generals they march forth, as ministers they return,
mastering both civil and martial arts.
They aid the state and pacify the people,
bearing the trust of ruler and subjects alike.
Majestic within the palace, solemn within the temple,
their fame resounds, their numinous power shines.
Too wondrous for words, they conceal their wrath.
All are extraordinary men of Yan and Zhao,
befriending one another like Lian and Lan.
In unity and harmony, they are trusted and employed.
They scale mountains and sail seas,
coming from a thousand miles away without hesitation.
They ride mists and soar through the void,
ascending directly to the heights of the Nine Heavens.

Today, as we perform this rite of requital and prayer for blessings,
the altar is purified, and the liturgy is about to commence.
We bow our heads in sincerity, wholeheartedly turning to the Dao.
To invite the true presence of the deities,
we must humbly reveal our innermost devotion,
relying on the Five Marshals to convey our plea.
We reverently beseech the Most High to descend,
greatly bestowing their compassionate vow.
May they grant our supplication,
and we offer our devout worship.

*All rise, each with reverence*
*Incense is offered*

With focused mind, the first offering of incense:
May the fragrance reach the Lingji Palace,
pervading the Lingji Palace,
where the sacred realm forms a canopy of clouds.
We offer to the Sacred Father, Prince Qi,
the Loyal and Martial Illustrious True Lord.

With focused mind, the second offering of incense:
May the fragrance reach the Lingji Palace,
pervading the Lingji Palace,
where the true realm forms a canopy of treasures.
We offer to the Great Immortal of the Golden Towers of the Nine Heavens,
Manifesting Dao and Attaining Virtue,
Universally Revealing Numinous Aid,
Pure and Subtle Cavernous Void,
Mysteriously Responsive,
Compassionate and Benevolent,
Protecting the State and Sheltering the People,
Bestowing Blessings and Vast Grace,
True Lord Hong’en.

With focused mind, the third offering of incense:
May the fragrance reach the Lingji Palace,
pervading the Lingji Palace,
where the immortal realm forms a canopy of flowers.
We offer to the Supreme Immortal of the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens,
Proclaiming Transformation and Upholding the Dao,
Illustrious and Universally Aiding,
Lofty and Profound,
Serene and Mysterious,
Wondrously Responsive,
Benevolent and Compassionate,
Assisting the State and Protecting the People,
Bestowing Blessings and Vast Grace,
True Lord Hong’en.

Kneeling before the censer:
The Dao is studied in the heart,
the heart transmits through incense.
Holding the jade censer,
the mind abides in the Nine Heavens.
May the True Lords deign to look down,
their immortal pendants approaching the hall.
Let our petition be conveyed,
directly reaching the Nine Heavens.

*All pay homage to the Perfected Ones, visualizing as prescribed*

**Five Stars Mantra**
The Five Stars array their radiance,
illuminating the five directions.
The Water Star averts disaster,
the Power of Wood brings prosperity.
Mars dispels misfortune,
Venus repels warfare.
Saturn guards the four quarters,
bringing benefit to family and state.
Inscribed on jade tablets,
recorded in the celestial chambers.
Riding the whirlwind and spreading light,
they soar through the great void.
Emerging from and entering the unseen,
they wander and feast in the ten directions.
Five-colored clouds form their canopy,
summoning spirits and commanding winds.
They employ the myriad numina,
harmonizing: "Above, protect the Immortal Elders."

*Twenty-four strikes of the Dharma drum resound*

**Opening the Censer**
The Most High Lord of the Five Numinous Ones summons forth
the Three and Five within our bodies,
the Merit Officers to left and right,
the Incense Officials and Envoys,
the Golden Lads who attend the incense,
the Jade Maidens who transmit words and scatter flowers,
the Daily Incense Officials,
the Merit Officer Envoys,
the Three Qi True Spirits—
hasten to ascend and convey this petition!

To the Five Great Marshals—Zha, Bian, Wei, Zhao, and Diao—
the Two Marshals of Yue and Xu,
the Heavenly Ding and Valiant Soldiers,
the Divine Officials to left and right:
We now ascend the altar for this Dharma rite,
reverently performing this requital and prayer for blessings.
All our sincere entreaties are set forth in the written petition.
Through this rite,
may we receive the vital qi of the true and authentic,
flowing into our bodies,
so that our words of supplication
swiftly reach the Most High Three Treasures,
the Heavenly Lords,
the Great Immortal of the Golden Towers of the Nine Heavens,
Manifesting Dao and Attaining Virtue,
Universally Revealing Numinous Aid,
Pure and Subtle Cavernous Void,
Mysteriously Responsive,
Compassionate and Benevolent,
Protecting the State and Sheltering the People,
Bestowing Blessings and Vast Grace,
True Lord Hong’en,
and the Supreme Immortal of the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens,
Proclaiming Transformation and Upholding the Dao,
Illustrious and Universally Aiding,
Lofty and Profound,
Serene and Mysterious,
Wondrously Responsive,
Benevolent and Compassionate,
Assisting the State and Protecting the People,
Bestowing Blessings and Vast Grace,
True Lord Hong’en.

Before the Sacred Ones, we bow once.

We, the undersigned [Name], together with the altar officials and assembly,
jointly and sincerely petition the Nine Heavens’ Golden Towers.
The sacred titles remain as above.

We humbly reflect:
Gou Long governs earth, pillars sustain valleys,
thus the altars of state and grain are established.
The Zhou revered scent, the Shang revered sound,
to commune with the power of the divine.
Not that blood sacrifices alone suffice,
for even humble offerings may be presented to kings and lords.
That which is sagely yet unknowable is called spirit.
That which is spirit yet can be named enters into sageliness.

We reverently invoke
the Great Immortal of the Golden Towers of the Nine Heavens,
Manifesting Dao and Attaining Virtue,
Universally Revealing Numinous Aid,
Pure and Subtle Cavernous Void,
Mysteriously Responsive,
Compassionate and Benevolent,
Protecting the State and Sheltering the People,
Bestowing Blessings and Vast Grace,
True Lord Hong’en,
and the Supreme Immortal of the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens,
Proclaiming Transformation and Upholding the Dao,
Illustrious and Universally Aiding,
Lofty and Profound,
Serene and Mysterious,
Wondrously Responsive,
Benevolent and Compassionate,
Assisting the State and Protecting the People,
Bestowing Blessings and Vast Grace,
True Lord Hong’en.

Uprightness is their virtue,
moving people with fortune and misfortune.
Hidden in earth, they are earth;
hidden in heaven, they are heaven—
their numinous power is unfathomable.
When they command the sun, it shines;
when they command the rain, it falls—
solely wielding the power of creation.
Their fame resounds, their presence overflows.
Above, they assist the Dipper Perfected at the North Pole,
silently participating in the mysterious learning of the Eastern Flower.
In union with the Dao, they guard the divine.
Their names are inscribed in the Golden Towers,
honored with titles of three or four characters.
Their offices shine in the treasure palace,
fitting the three thousand ranks of conduct.
Responding to circumstances, they vow to deliver people.
Having received the grace of their sheltering care,
how dare we neglect the rites of prayer and exorcism?

Reverently, as the divine carriage descends to the altar,
some wear immortal pendants, their steps measured,
eight phoenixes singing behind.
Some don court robes, their presence majestic,
a hundred riders welcoming before and after.
The immortal retinue arrays in splendor,
divine officials guarding left and right.
We welcome the True Ones with humble offerings,
their virtuous mirror perceiving our sincerity.
Unworthy as we are, we bow our heads again and again,
reverently inviting the divine presence.

**Inviting the Sacred Ones**
We respectfully invoke.

chunks.original_text: 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君， 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 圣位同前 伏望真慈降临坛所，向来奉请，已沐降临，请序仙班，咸分列坐。 醮官虔诚设拜，上香，酒陈初献，举散花。 具位某，同诚上启圣位同前 恭闻仁义着称，枝叶分偃王之裔。 忠武不屈，簪缨袭齐国之封。 仁声肇着於闽中，德誉远闻於海宇。 勒名钟鼎，立传史书。 出戍於峡江之南，吏民之按堵如故。 立帜於鳌峰之上，盗贼之余党剿除。 顿令福地之安，均荷尧天之赐。 恩敢忘於结草，诗可咏於甘棠。 死庙食，生可封，可谓至矣。 法施民，劳定国，于今称之。 昔焉，草木效公山之灵。 今也，田畴息洪水之害。 民船激石，果闻黄旗救援之声。 邻火反风，永无曲突焦烂之患。 嘉定之蝗虫不入境，宝庆之旱魑不为灾。 红蛇现而雨沛，九天神龙出而雷轰。 万里无迹可见，夜何现於天灯。 无声可闻，日何闻於丝竹。 事迹千年留石碣，主封累代侈金书。 致士民千里以来归，宜香火四时而夤奉。 惟德是辅，岂徒黍稷之馨。 非类不歆，特重粢盛之洁。 建功积善，执戒修斋。 若非上格於天心，何以超升於仙秩。 钦承 帝命，仰沐玄风，特书金阙、玉阙之名，颁降大仙、上倦之号。 道吾道也，德吾德也。 化神化之教，神教之不惟夸一时，而荣一身。 抑示光乃前，而振乃后。 亲睦有教，燕喜有堂。 上瞻圣父、圣母之尊严，下列圣子、圣孙之富贵。 圣舅名登於紫府，圣兄庙食於金陵。 神后夫人，专掌注生之籍。 圣妃仙□，环居内侍之班。 或分福录之司，或任公卿之职。 权尊五帅，勇冠三军。 乃武乃文，在左在右。 庙镇七闽之地，其盛蔑以加诸德。 参五岳之灵，非至圣孰能与此。 功高名席，德被凡流。 赖神之庇，遗我以安。 一饮一啄，初不敢忘。 三沐三熏，敬之如在。 只迎宝驭，少鉴鬯人。 斋事之勤，爰集羽流，敢献碧落空歌之瑞。 臣等百拜，恭祝当今皇帝亿载万年为父母，保子姓以安全，千禄百福宜君王。 卑皇图而永久，所有疏文，谨当宣献。 宣疏 按如疏文，已具敷宣，伏冀仙慈，俯垂省览。 捍患御灾，礼特严於祀典。 报功崇德，职宜进於仙阶。 荐膺金阙之缇书，荣侍玉皇之香案。 二气吐纳，深究出青入玄之方。 七液周流，有得抱黄回紫之妙。 在身为独善之美，於人施兼济之功。 所感必通，有求必应。 救民疾苦，何须扁鹊之书。 卜地阴阳，默授景纯之学。 问婚者，宜家宜室。 所嗣者，生子生孙。 求仕者，劝之以勤孝。 立身行商者，告之以仁义为利。 农力於穑，工精其能。 远者悦而近者来，藏诸仁而显诸用。 皈心向道，皆蒙启迪之恩。 戴白垂髫，俱托帡据之庇。 今辰修设醉恩祈福道场。 再祝名香，迓真游之降格。 重行清酌，祈肱驾以来临。 伏愿 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微恫玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君， 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高朋弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 福录来，备享广食於无穷。 华夏肃清，翊皇图於永久。 虔诚设拜，上香，酒陈亚献。 举，散花。 具位某，与坛官众等，同诚上启圣位如前。 伏闻一片罗池碑，终古难磨其英气。
chunks.translated_text:
The Most Radiant and Dao-Attaining, Virtue-Manifesting Great Immortal of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Portal, whose boundless efficacy pervades the Pure Subtlety of the Cavernous Mystery, whose subtle responsiveness is vast and empty, whose compassion and kindness protect the state and shelter the people, whose abundant blessings bestow vast grace—Perfected Lord of Majestic Favor,

The Most Illustrious and Teaching-Spreading, Dao-Propagating Supreme Immortal of the Nine Heavens’ Jade Portal, whose luminous efficacy is far-reaching and all-embracing, whose lofty clarity and profound tranquility subtly respond with benevolence, whose aid to the state and protection of the people bring exalted blessings and vast grace—Perfected Lord of Majestic Favor.

The sacred ranks remain as before.
We humbly beseech Your True Compassion to descend upon this altar.
Having already received Your gracious descent in response to our invocation,
we now invite the immortal assembly to take their ordered seats in due rank.

The Jiao officiants reverently bow in devotion,
present incense,
offer the first libation of wine,
and scatter blossoms.

We, [Name], in shared sincerity, reverently address the sacred ranks as before.

We have heard that renown in benevolence and righteousness
traces its lineage to the scions of kings.
Unbending loyalty and martial valor
inherited the noble ranks of the State of Qi.
Benevolent fame first flourished in Min,
while virtuous repute spread far across land and sea.
Names were inscribed on bronze tripods,
and deeds recorded in historical annals.
Stationed south of the Gorges, the people remained undisturbed.
Raising banners on Aofeng, the remnants of bandits were eradicated.
Thus, the blessed land was secured,
and all equally enjoyed the gifts of a Yao-like reign.
How could one forget such grace, even to repay with withered grass?
The ode to the sweet pear tree still resounds.
In death, temples and sacrifices;
in life, enfeoffment—
this is the utmost honor.
Teaching the Dao to the people,
laboring to pacify the state—
to this day, these are praised.

Of old, even grasses and trees responded to the mountain’s numen.
Now, fields are spared the scourge of floods.
Boats striking rocks heard the cry of the Yellow Banner’s rescue.
Neighboring fires turned back with the wind,
forever sparing the threat of scorched chimneys.
In Jiading, locusts did not cross the border;
in Baoqing, drought demons wrought no disaster.
When the red serpent appeared, rain poured forth;
when the Nine Heavens’ divine dragon emerged, thunder roared.
For ten thousand li, no trace was seen—
yet how did the night reveal celestial lamps?
No sound was heard—
yet how did the day resound with strings and woodwinds?
Deeds endured for a thousand years, carved in stone;
enfeoffments through successive generations, inscribed in gold.
Thus, scholars and commoners journeyed from afar to pay homage,
and incense and offerings were reverently presented through all seasons.

Only virtue is upheld—
not merely the fragrance of millet and grain.
Only the proper kind is venerated—
especially the purity of sacrificial offerings.
Building merit and accumulating goodness,
holding precepts and practicing purification.
Had this not ascended to the heart of Heaven,
how could one have transcended to the ranks of immortals?

By imperial decree,
we revere the mysterious wind,
inscribing the names of the Golden and Jade Portals,
bestowing the titles of Great Immortal and Supreme Perfected.
The Dao is our Dao,
virtue is our virtue.
Transforming the teachings of gods and spirits,
the divine teachings do not merely glorify a single moment or a single person—
they illuminate what came before
and inspire what comes after.
Teaching harmony among kin,
the Hall of Joyful Feasting stands.
Above, we gaze upon the august majesty of the Sacred Father and Sacred Mother;
below, the Sacred Sons and Sacred Grandsons enjoy prosperity.
The Sacred Uncle’s name is recorded in the Purple Palace;
the Sacred Elder Brother receives temple sacrifices in Jinling.
The Divine Empress and Lady,
solely in charge of the Register of Births.
The Sacred Consort and Immortal [Title],
surrounded by the ranks of inner attendants.
Some oversee the Bureau of Blessings,
others hold the offices of ministers and nobles.
Authority surpasses the Five Marshals,
valor leads the Three Armies.
Whether martial or civil,
whether left or right.
The temple guards the land of the Seven Min—
its grandeur unmatched in virtue.
Its numen rivals the Five Peaks—
who but the Most Sacred could compare?
Merits towering, name enduring,
virtue extending to all beings.
By the shelter of the divine,
we are left in peace.
Every sip and bite—
dare we ever forget?
Thrice bathed, thrice perfumed—
we revere as if You were present.

Now, as we welcome Your precious carriage,
deign to regard this humble servant.
The diligence of the purification rites
has gathered the feathered ones;
we dare present the auspicious "Empty Song of the Azure Heavens."

We, your servants, bow a hundred times,
reverently wishing the present Emperor
ten thousand years of life as father and mother of the realm,
safeguarding descendants with security,
bestowing upon the sovereign a thousand blessings and a hundred fortunes.
May the imperial enterprise endure forever.

All memorial texts have been duly recited.
The memorial is now proclaimed.
As the text has been fully declaimed,
we humbly beseech the immortal compassion to deign to peruse it.

Averting calamities and warding off disasters,
the rites are especially solemn in the sacrificial canon.
Repaying merit and exalting virtue,
it is fitting to advance the immortal ranks.
May they be recommended for the vermilion records of the Golden Portal,
honored to attend the incense table of the Jade Emperor.
Inhaling and exhaling the Two Qi,
profoundly mastering the methods of emerging from the blue and entering the mysterious.
The Seven Fluids circulating,
attaining the subtleties of embracing the yellow and returning to the purple.
In oneself, the beauty of self-cultivation;
toward others, the merit of universal salvation.
All that is felt is surely communicated;
all that is sought is surely answered.
Relieving the people’s suffering—
what need is there for Bian Que’s prescriptions?
Divining the yin and yang of land—
silently imparting the learning of Guo Pu.
For those seeking marriage—
harmony in family and household.
For those desiring heirs—
the birth of sons and grandsons.
For those pursuing office—
exhorted to diligence and filial piety.
For those establishing themselves or engaging in trade—
taught that benevolence and righteousness are profit.
Farmers toil in the fields;
artisans refine their skills.
The distant are pleased and the near come forth,
treasuring benevolence and manifesting its use.
Turning their hearts toward the Dao,
all receive the grace of enlightenment.
From white-haired elders to children with hanging locks,
all rely on Your sheltering care.

Today, we conduct this rite of gratitude and prayer for blessings.
Again, we offer fragrant incense,
welcoming the descent of the True Ones.
Once more, we present the pure libation,
praying for the arrival of the divine carriage.

We humbly pray:
The Most Radiant and Dao-Attaining, Virtue-Manifesting Great Immortal of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Portal, whose boundless efficacy pervades the Pure Subtlety of the Cavernous Mystery, whose subtle responsiveness is vast and empty, whose compassion and kindness protect the state and shelter the people, whose abundant blessings bestow vast grace—Perfected Lord of Majestic Favor,

The Most Illustrious and Teaching-Spreading, Dao-Propagating Supreme Immortal of the Nine Heavens’ Jade Portal, whose luminous efficacy is far-reaching and all-embracing, whose lofty clarity and profound tranquility subtly respond with benevolence, whose aid to the state and protection of the people bring exalted blessings and vast grace—Perfected Lord of Majestic Favor.

May the Register of Blessings come,
bestowing boundless feasts for eternal enjoyment.
May the land of Hua-Xia be purified,
supporting the imperial enterprise forever.

Reverently bowing in devotion,
presenting incense,
offering the second libation of wine,
and scattering blossoms.

We, [Name], together with the altar officials and all present,
in shared sincerity, reverently address the sacred ranks as before.

We have heard that the Luo Pond Stele,
through all ages, cannot efface its heroic spirit.

chunks.original_text: 千年东华洞，至今孰绍其真风。 洪惟守土之神，积此弥天之行。 骨像合仙於广惠，文章并驾於柳候。 若非星宿之储精，必也山川之孕秀。 有诗、歌、赋诵之可述，须严大书特书至於屡书。 言吉凶祻福以无差，未免初渎，再渎，烦垂三渎。 灼见显幽之理，预明倚伏之机。 貌重而威，畏之如严霜烈日。 道高且远，仰之如北斗泰山。 盛德昭昭，神灵剡剡。 今辰修设酬恩祈福道场，伏愿三光平而寒暑时，五谷熟而人民育。 物无疵疠，国有祯祥。 凡属生成，率归大道。 虔诚设拜，上香，酒陈终献。 散花，讽经，宣疏。 入七政灯入愿大谢 具位某，与坛官众等，再炷名香， 普同供养。 圣位如前。 伏闻鳌峰竦杰，可攀天上之星辰。 龙首轩昂，沛作人间之雨露。 良以感恩於平日，将何酬报於今时。 清供载陈，愧乏玉瓮金醴。 仙家所茹，无非火枣交梨。 今则宝篆香残，银缸焰冷。 星冠羽服，步虚远彻於瑶宫。 雾辇云軿，队仗将旋於金阙。 徒切驰情於恋恋，更祈降福之秾秾。 云云。
chunks.translated_text:
The Thousand-Year Grotto of Eastern Florescence—who has inherited its true wind to this day? Solemnly we recall the earth-guarding deities, whose deeds have amassed boundless merit. Their skeletal forms merge with immortals in vast beneficence, their literary brilliance rivals that of Lord Liu. If not celestial essences stored in the stars, they must be the finest nurtured by mountains and rivers. Their poems, songs, and odes endure in recitation, demanding solemn inscription—inscribed once, inscribed again, inscribed repeatedly. Their words on fortune and misfortune, blessings and calamities, never err. Yet we dare not presume: first we invoke, then invoke again, and humbly beseech a third invocation. The principles of manifest and hidden are revealed with clarity; the mechanisms of rise and fall are foreseen. Their countenance is grave and majestic—feared like the biting frost and scorching sun. Their Dao is lofty and far-reaching—revered like the Northern Dipper and Mount Tai. Their virtue shines resplendently; their divine efficacy gleams sharply.

Today, we establish this ritual altar to requite kindness and pray for blessings. May we humbly beseech: the Three Luminaries remain balanced, cold and heat arrive in season; the Five Grains ripen, and the people flourish. May all things be free from pestilence, and the state abound in auspicious omens. All that is created and sustained shall return to the Great Dao.

Reverently bowing in devotion,
presenting incense,
offering the final libation of wine.
Scattering blossoms, chanting scriptures, and proclaiming the memorial.

Entering the Seven Governors’ Lamps to fulfill vows and offer profound gratitude.

We, [Name], together with the altar officials and all present,
once more kindle incense of renown,
universally offering reverence.
The sacred ranks as before.

We have heard that the towering peaks of Ao rise so high they may grasp the stars of heaven. The dragon’s head rears proudly, bestowing abundant rain and dew upon the mortal realm. Having long received their grace in ordinary days, how shall we repay them in this moment? Pure offerings are laid forth, though we are shamed by the lack of jade urns and golden nectar. The immortals’ fare consists of nothing but fiery jujubes and intertwined pears. Now the precious talismanic incense has burned low, the silver lamp’s flame grows cold. Star-crowned and feather-robed, the steps of the void resound far into the Jade Palace. Cloud chariots and mist-borne carriages, the procession prepares to return to the Golden Portal. Though our hearts race with longing, we earnestly pray for blessings ever more abundant.

Thus it is spoken.

chunks.translated_text:
Recite the Ten Contemplations:
First, body and mind grow pure and cool.
Second, the nature’s wisdom becomes perfectly luminous.
Third, the Dao is revered and virtue exalted.
Fourth, conduct is fulfilled and merit accomplished.
Fifth, the hun-soul and spirit become serene and upright.
Sixth, demon kings offer protection and welcome.
Seventh, celestial officials bestow blessings.
Eighth, the underworld erases one’s name.
Ninth, the dark paths do not approach.
Tenth, the Pure Land grants eternal life.

Replenish the incense burner.
May the Incense Officials and Envoys, the Divine Lords of the Left and Right, and the Attendant Spirit-Officials of the Incense,
cause this place of our ritual to naturally birth golden elixir, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms.
May the assembled hosts of a hundred spirits and perfected beings rejoice in this gathering before the incense burner.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions receive the rising incense smoke,
and swiftly convey the words we have just uttered,
directly to the *Perfected of the Utmost Non-Polar Great Dao, Radiant Dao and Penetrating Virtue, Great Immortal Manifesting Universal Salvation, Pure and Subtle Cavern-Mystery, Void and Wondrous Response, Compassionate and Benevolent Protector of the Nation and Shelter of the People, August Spirit of Vast Grace and Great Favor, Perfected Lord*;
and to the *Perfected of the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens, Propagating Transformation and Upholding the Dao, Supreme Immortal of Illustrious Efficacy and Vast Salvation, Lofty and Profound, Vast and Tranquil, Subtle and Responsive, Benevolent and Kind, Assistant of the Nation and Protector of the People, Exalted Spirit of Abundant Blessings and Great Favor, Perfected Lord*.

Escort forth the *Holy Father, Loyal and Martial Supporter of the Luminous*.

chunks.translated_text:
Upon the completion of the ritual fast, we reverently bear the profound grace. With devoted hearts and bowed heads, we now send forth the *Perfected Lords of Vast Grace of the Golden Towers of the Nine Heavens* and the *Perfected Lords of Vast Grace of the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens*. The cloud-borne chariots do not tarry, nor can the crane-drawn carriages be detained. When future rites are held, we shall once more extend our invitation.

**Returning Chant**
The paired chariots return, borne on five-colored clouds,
Soaring high into the ninefold heavens.
Swiftly they vanish into the distant skies,
While the ritual site abounds with fragrant qi.
Profound grace suffuses the cosmos,
Blessings and fortune fill mountains and rivers.
Longing for the path of immortals,
Freely they ascend to the Great Loftiness.

Holy virtue endures in the ritual teachings,
The fast bestows long life and prosperity.
Life is prolonged by the jade tablets,
Petitions are presented in golden missives.
Sins are erased from the Northern Bureau,
Names are inscribed in the Southern Prosperity.
All the living enjoy extended years,
While the Perfected descend with auspicious blessings.

For the merits of the rites just performed, we pray the Perfected Lords bestow flowing grace and favor. Together, may all rely on virtuous deeds to ascend the Way, and may all devotees receive this offering.

**Dedication**
The Great Dao knows no bounds,
Like the radiance of good companions in the light.
The Perfect City responds to sincerity,
As echoes answer within the valley.
Now, for so-and-so, we humbly pray:
May the one who dwells in the northern palace’s splendor
Enjoy rivers clear and seas calm.
May their longevity match the steadfastness of the southern mountains,
With earth enduring and heaven eternal.
May civil and martial officials alike
See their ranks and emoluments increase.
May all within the palace gates
Rely on health and peace.
May the realm delight in the winds of great peace,
And all beings benefit from the power of nurturing virtue.

Relying on the assembly of the Dharma, we offer this for the highest good.

Recitation:
The Three Pure Ones and Three Realms Heavenly Worthies,
The Nine Heavens’ Blessing Heavenly Worthies,
The Ten Directions’ Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies,
Whose merits are beyond conception.

The Perfected Lords’ ritual is complete.
The Perfected Lords’ vows are fulfilled.

chunks.original_text: 祝香 以今恭焚宝香，虔诚供养 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君。 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君， 宫中神仙、诸灵官，普同供养。 恭闻神之显德，曰正直而曰聪明。 人所常情，歆安逸而愿富贵。 祭也必受福也，礼乎无太简乎。 庙食余四百年，香火如彼其盛。 碑铭凡一千字，文章可得而闻。 昭昭不朽之名，凛凛如生之义。 功全社稷，德在生灵。 农力於耕，有黍稷稻粱之庆。 工精其艺，合准绳规矩之程。 士以忠孝立身，商以仁义为利。 问婚者，宜家宜室。 祈嗣者，生子生孙。 风风人，雨雨人，均遂生成之愿。 衣衣我，食食我，俱沾温饱之仁。 施之万物得其宜，措之四时得其序。 仰之如泰山、北斗，厥光大矣，不我遐遗。 现则为景星庆云，争先睹之，以为快乐。 宜受大礼，以宣厥灵。 昔膺勑额之荣，今荷天恩之宠。 位既登於金阙、玉阙，名乃进於大仙、上仙。 徽号褒崇，威仪赫奕。 祀延百世，表正万神。 与大造以为徒长，上古而不老。 伏念某心虽慕道，材不如人。 少伸昭谢之私，略致涓埃之敬。 具严汯会，干，渎真聪。 伏愿呜玉鸾兮，啾啾，驾八龙兮蜿蜿。 率云霓兮来迓，令阊阖兮开关。 先使丰降兮前驱，后使飞廉兮奔属。 委厥美兮从容，赛将澹兮寿光。 桂酒奠兮椒浆，蕙肴蒸兮兰籍。 逍遥兮容与，低回兮怀顾。 某等下情无任勤拳显俟之至，白所有真君，本愿神咒，谨当持诵真君真君，北斗大神云云。 向来神咒，已具敷宣。 奉请圣父齐王忠武翊亮真君、 圣母仁寿淑善仙妃、 九天金阙、玉阙二位真君、泾国、卫国二位仙妃。 法驾降临预会众真列班朝礼。 朝礼周，各升法座，虔诚设拜，上香。 叹香执炉 伏以明德以荐，非黍稷之能馨。 为善之徒，与芝兰而俱臭。 是香也。 玉炉献瑞，金鼎呈祥。 郁郁纷纷，结为云烟之气。 融融霭霭，陶成宇宙之春。 捧之则有使者立吾前，侍之则有童子立于吾后。 有醮云：稽首虔诚供养。 无醮云：酒陈初献。 奉此侑樽汯众，运心虔诚供养。 吟香偈 天上云荷种，刚风落四溟。 深沈秘龙宫，海神献仙众。 今热荐诚恳，氤氲上紫宸。 洞达入无为，所求皆如愿。 和：众等一心供养。 散花。 洞案炉烟起。 旋边。 叹水捧水盂
chunks.translated_text:
**Incense Offering**

Today, with reverence, we kindle precious incense,
devoutly offering it to the **Nine Heavens’ Golden Palace Illuminated Dao, Virtue-Attaining Great Immortal, Manifestly Numinous, Universally Salvific, Pure and Subtle, Vast and Void, Wondrously Responsive, Compassionate and Benevolent, Protector of the Realm, Shelter of the People, Exalted in Blessing, Vast in Grace Perfected Lord**;
to the **Nine Heavens’ Jade Palace Proclaiming Transformation, Upholding the Dao, Supreme Immortal, Radiantly Numinous, Vastly Salvific, Lofty and Bright, Vast and Serene, Profoundly Tranquil, Wondrously Responsive, Benevolent and Kind, Assisting the Realm, Blessing the People, Abundant in Blessing, Vast in Grace Perfected Lord**;
and to the **Palace Immortals and all Divine Officials**, universally offered together.

We have heard that the manifest virtue of the gods
is called uprightness and called wisdom.
What mortals commonly desire
is ease and wealth, honor and nobility.
Sacrifice must bring blessing—
neither too spare in ritual nor too lavish.
For four hundred years, temple offerings have flourished,
incense fires burning ever bright.
Steles bear a thousand characters,
inscriptions to be heard and known.
Their luminous, undying names,
their awe-inspiring, life-like righteousness—
merits securing the altars of state,
virtues abiding in all living beings.
Farmers toil in the fields,
reaping the bounty of millet, rice, and grain.
Artisans hone their crafts,
meeting the standards of plumb, line, compass, and square.
Scholars establish themselves through loyalty and filial piety,
merchants profit through benevolence and righteousness.
Those who seek marriage
find harmony in home and household.
Those who pray for descendants
beget sons and grandsons.
Wind to the people, rain to the people—
all fulfill the wishes of growth and nurture.
Clothing for me, food for me—
all partake in the kindness of warmth and sustenance.
Bestowed upon the myriad things, all is fitting;
ordained through the four seasons, all is in order.
Gazing up to them is like beholding Mount Tai or the Northern Dipper—
their radiance is vast, never distant from us.
When they manifest, they appear as auspicious stars and felicitous clouds,
and all vie to behold them, counting it their joy.

We now offer grand rites to proclaim their numinosity.
Once they received the honor of imperial bestowal,
now they bear the favor of Heaven’s grace.
Their rank ascends to Golden Palace and Jade Palace,
their names advance to Great Immortal and Supreme Immortal.
Their honorific titles are exalted,
their majesty resplendent.
Their sacrifices endure for a hundred generations,
their standards guide the myriad spirits.
They stand as elders among the great creators,
ancient yet never aging.

We, though our hearts yearn for the Dao,
are unworthy in talent.
We humbly express our private gratitude,
offering this meager token of reverence.
With solemn assembly prepared,
we venture to disturb the gods’ wisdom.

We pray:
May jade phoenixes sing *jiu-jiu*,
may eight dragons coil in winding flight.
Lead the clouds and rainbows to descend,
command the gates of Heaven to swing wide.
First send Feng Jiang as vanguard,
then dispatch Fei Lian to follow in haste.
Bestow your grace with ease,
grant us the serene light of longevity.
Pour cassia wine and peppered ale,
steam orchid-wrapped delicacies on fragrant mats.
Roam freely, linger in leisure,
turn back in fond remembrance.

Our humble hearts are filled with earnest devotion,
awaiting your manifest presence.
All the Perfected Lords’ original vows and divine incantations,
we now diligently recite—
**Perfected Lords, Perfected Lords, Northern Dipper Great Spirits...**

The preceding divine incantations have been fully proclaimed.
We now reverently invite:
**Sacred Father, Loyal and Martial Duke of Qi, Illuminating and Upholding Perfected Lord**;
**Sacred Mother, Benevolent and Longevous, Kind and Virtuous Immortal Consort**;
the **Two Perfected Lords of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Palace and Jade Palace**;
the **Two Immortal Consorts of Jing and Wei Kingdoms**.
May their divine processions descend to join the assembly,
where the host of Perfected Ones array themselves in ranks to pay homage.

The homage complete, each ascends to their ritual seat.
With devotion, we bow and offer incense.

**Chanting Incense, Holding the Censer**
We humbly submit:
Bright virtue is offered, yet not through millet or grain can its fragrance be matched.
Those who walk the path of goodness
share their scent with orchids and angelica.
This incense—
jade censers emit auspiciousness,
golden tripods present omens.
Thick and billowing,
it coalesces into clouds and mist.
Warm and misty,
it nurtures the spring of the cosmos.
Holding it, messengers stand before us;
attending it, youths stand behind us.

If this is a ritual feast:
We bow our heads in reverence, devoutly offering.
If not:
The first libation of wine is presented.

With this, we accompany the sacred assembly,
directing our hearts in sincere offering.

**Incense Verse**
Cloud lotuses grow in Heaven,
strong winds scatter them across the four seas.
Deep within the dragon palace’s secrets,
sea gods present them to the immortals.
Today, with fervent devotion,
the fragrant smoke ascends to the purple court.
Penetrating and attaining the effortless,
all prayers are fulfilled as wished.

**Response:**
All together, with one heart, we offer.

**Scattering Flowers.**
The censer’s smoke rises in swirling eddies.
Circling the altar.

**Chanting Water, Holding the Water Vessel**

chunks.original_text: 伏以演汗可荐於王公，惟有忠信以为质，源水不舍於昼夜，自惭声闻之过情。 是水也，不浊不昏，常清常净。 天上为雨露，承之以铜柱金茎。 地下为醴泉，餐之如琼浆玉液。 知者行其所无，以事上善，若此而不争。 无水不朝东，其源来自此。 有醮云：稽首虔诚供养。 无醮云：酒陈亚献。 奉此侑樽，汯众运心，虔诚供养。 吟水偈 天上银河溢，泓澄映十方。 变成雨露来，覃恩大天地。 润下滋枯槁，涵濡泽万生。 酌水表丹衷，身心悉清浄。 和：众等一心供养。 散花。 源流非地脉，散花林。 灌溉自天河。 云云。 旋远。
chunks.translated_text:
Prostrate, we reflect:
Even the sweat of toil may be offered to lords and nobles,
for loyalty and trust alone form its essence.
Yet the source-water flows ceaselessly day and night,
and we humbly confess our voices exceed our merit.

This water—
neither turbid nor dim—
remains ever clear, ever pure.
In Heaven, it becomes rain and dew,
caught by bronze pillars and golden stalks.
On Earth, it is sweet spring,
consumed like jade nectar and liquid jasper.
The wise act where nothing is lacking,
serving the highest good without contention.
No water fails to flow east—
its source arises here.

If this is a ritual feast:
We bow our heads in reverence, devoutly offering.
If not:
The second libation of wine is presented.
With this, we accompany the sacred assembly,
directing our hearts in sincere offering.

**Water Verse**
The silver river of Heaven overflows,
its limpid depths reflecting the ten directions.
Transformed, it descends as rain and dew,
bestowing boundless grace upon Heaven and Earth.
Moistening below, it revives the withered;
permeating, it nourishes all life.
Pouring this water, we express our red hearts—
body and mind wholly cleansed.

**Response:**
All together, with one heart, we offer.

**Scattering Flowers.**
Not from earthly veins, the flowing source—
scattering blossoms in the grove.
Irrigation from the celestial river.
*[Chanting continues.]*
Circling afar.

chunks.original_text: 叹花　献花 伏以翠叶重重，以停荫於清净之绪。 玉葩郁郁，乃生神於大有之庭。 是花也，香本自□，色无定色。 池莲红者，忽变为碧。 牡丹白者，可染为黄。 广寒宫中桂一枝，影施秋月。 武陵洞裹桃千树，靥笑春风。 欲倾葵蕾之情，少寓苹蘩之礼。 有醮云：稽首虔诚供养。 无醮云：酒陈终献，奉此侑樽，汯众运心，虔诚供养。 吟花偈 玄圃珍葩盛，盘根蔓十方。 挺秀八百年，垂芳及尘世。 伟烨光明界，缤纷雨宝花。 采得最清英，我今与共养。 和：众等一心供养。 散花。 散花何处香。
chunks.translated_text:
**Praise of Flowers / Offering of Flowers**
We bow in reverence, observing how layer upon layer of jade-green leaves
provide sheltering shade for the threads of purity.
How lush and fragrant the jasper blossoms,
born in the courtyard of the Great Possession.
These flowers—
their fragrance arises from □,
their hues know no fixed form.
The red lotus of the pond
suddenly shifts to emerald.
The white peony
may be dyed to gold.
From the Palace of Broad Cold, a single osmanthus branch—
its shadow cast upon the autumn moon.
Within the Wu-ling grotto, a thousand peach trees—
their dimpled smiles in the spring breeze.
To pour forth the devotion of sunflowers,
we humbly present the rites of duckweed and white milfoil.

If this is a ritual feast:
We bow our heads in reverence, devoutly offering.
If not:
The final libation of wine is presented.
With this, we accompany the sacred assembly,
directing our hearts in sincere offering.

**Flower Verse**
Rare blossoms flourish in the Dark Garden,
their roots spreading through the ten directions.
Standing tall for eight hundred years,
their fragrance descends to the dusty world.
Resplendent in the realm of radiant light,
scattering like jeweled flowers in the rain.
Gathering the purest essence,
we now offer them together.

**Response:**
All together, with one heart, we offer.

**Scattering Flowers.**
Where do the scattered flowers find their fragrance?

chunks.original_text: 旋绕 诵真君经闻经云云 伏以游神於道，视不见，听不闻。 守道以神，瞻在前，忽在后。 隐无终隐，名起强名。 自赤明开图，天书之所由降。 及天直按笔，人文之所以兴。 帝誉授之於牧德台前，黄帝传之於峨眉山上。 或得於勾曲，符阖闾之愿。 或降於钟山，成夏禹之功。 矧兹经教之流传，使我众生而解悟。 兹盖伏遇 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇 福洪恩真君、 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君， 上佐斗真於北极，内参玄学於东华。 百万亿劫，劫劫修来。 五十五愿，愿愿得度。 炼金成凤篆，揉玉写龙章。 愿共诸有情，同乘无上道。 道场众等，稽首皈依，志心赞咏。 唱咏真君本愿赞同声 上朝帝座，身进天阶。 光依日月，职掌三台。 列宿拱卫，蕾买汉昭回。 东方龙角，独占斗魁。 华盖房驷，辅弼严明。 羽林将军，左导右迎。 埙帘迭奏，律吕合声。 荣归天府，万里云程。 举。 道场众等人，各虔诚赞礼 如法。 志心皈命礼，德配乾坤，功参日月，神通妙用，正直聪明，大慈大悲，大圣大愿，随机赴感，发誓度人。 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君。 志心皈命礼，威震雷霆，泽垂雨露，神通自在，福德无边，大慈大悲大圣大愿，随岁赴感，发誓度人 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 大道巍巍不可名，九天旺气属真君。 古往今来无纪极，百千变化妙通神。 和：今将圣德虔诚赞，愿赐威光鉴此忱。 愿共诸有情，同皈无上道。 志心皈命礼，德配乾坤，功参日月云云。 九天金阙云。 志心皈命礼，威震雷霆，泽垂雨露云云。 九天玉阙云。 鼻祖开基国始徐，朱弓赤矢降祥符。 子孙枝叶昌而大，魁士名人载史书。 和：今将圣德虔诚赞云云。 志心皈命礼，德配乾坤，云云。 九天金阙云。 志心皈命礼。 威震雷霆，泽垂雨露云云。 九天金阙云。 纷纷五代霸争雄，独起淮南立大功。 忠武盛名垂竹帛，千年齐国袭王封。 和：今将圣德虔诚赞云云。 志心皈命礼，德配乾坤云云。 九天金阙云。 志心皈命礼，威震雷霆云云。 九天玉阙云。 义举王师下七闽，七闽效顺不交兵。
chunks.translated_text:
Circling in procession, we recite the *Scripture of the Perfected Lords*, having heard its teachings.
Thus we submit: when the spirit wanders in the Dao, sight perceives nothing, hearing discerns nothing.
When the spirit abides in the Dao, what was before the eyes suddenly appears behind.
Hidden yet never ceasing to be hidden—its name arises from a forced designation.

Since the dawn of the Crimson Clarity and the unfolding of heaven’s charts, the descent of celestial scriptures began.
When the Celestial Scribe wielded the brush, the flourishing of human culture arose.
The Emperor’s Renown bestowed it before the Terrace of Pastoral Virtue;
the Yellow Emperor transmitted it upon Mount Emei.
Some received it at Gourd Valley, fulfilling the vow of Helü’s sealed talismans.
Some descended upon Bell Mountain, accomplishing the merit of Great Yu.
How much more does the transmission of these scriptural teachings
awaken the understanding of all sentient beings?

This is solely by the grace of
**The Perfected Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Portal, Illuminator of the Dao and Attainer of Virtue, Great Immortal Manifesting Numinous Pervasive Salvation, Pure and Subtle Cavernous Mystery, Void and Wondrous Response, Compassionate and Benevolent Protector of the State and Shelterer of the People, Exalter of Blessings and Bestower of Vast Grace**,
and
**The Perfected Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Jade Portal, Proclaimer of Transformation and Upholder of the Teachings, Supreme Immortal of Radiant Numinosity, Vast Salvation, Lofty Clarity, Vast Stillness, Profound Serenity, Wondrous Response, Benevolent and Merciful Assistant to the State and Guardian of the People, Bestower of Abundant Blessings and Vast Grace**,
who assist the Dipper Perfected at the Northern Culmen
and inwardly participate in the Mysteries of the Eastern Flower.
Through a hundred million kalpas, they cultivate without cease.
Fifty-five vows, each vow fulfilled in deliverance.
Refining gold into phoenix scripts, kneading jade to inscribe dragon chapters.
May all sentient beings together ascend the Supreme Dao.

The assembly of this Dao altar bows their heads in reverence, devoting their hearts to praise.
In unison, we chant the *Hymn of the Perfected Lords’ Original Vows*:

Ascending the imperial throne, advancing upon the celestial steps.
Radiance dependent on sun and moon, office encompassing the Three Terraces.
The ranked stars pay homage; the Han’s luminaries revolve in splendor.
The Dragon’s Horn in the east alone claims the Dipper’s head.
The Flowery Canopy and Chamber Steeds serve as strict and bright attendants.
The Feathered Forest Generals escort left and right.
The ocarina and reed-pipe play in alternation; the pitch-pipes harmonize in sound.
Returning in glory to the Celestial Palace, a journey of ten thousand leagues through the clouds.

**Response:**
The assembly of this Dao altar, each with utmost devotion, offers reverence according to the rites.

With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
One whose virtue matches Heaven and Earth, whose merit parallels sun and moon,
whose numinous efficacy is wondrous, whose nature is upright and perceptive,
great in compassion, great in mercy, great in sageliness, great in vows,
who responds to conditions and answers prayers, who vows to deliver all beings—

Her merits secure the altars of soil and grain, her blessings extend to descendants,
Most sacred, most numinous, most venerable, most solemn,
The Divine Father, Prince of Qi, Loyal and Martial Illustrious True Lord.

The *Book of Songs* and *Book of Rites* were earnestly taught in the hall where carp were leapt,
Her inner assistance in the household was most strict and bright.
Before the hall, she learned the play of the patterned robe,
Offering longevity blessings for a thousand springs, presenting the rhinoceros-horn cup.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Numinous Palace, in the Hall of Harmonious Kinship,
Most sagely, most kind, most wise, most serene and devoted,
Her position upright in the central palace, her merits perfected in inner assistance,
Her frugal virtue manifest, transforming those below, her illustrious deeds recorded in poetry and song,
Her yin rites cultivated, her teachings transforming, her fragrant name shining in the historical records,
Having cherished her parents’ loving kindness, she dared to express the household’s joyous rites,
Most sacred, most numinous, most compassionate, most loving,
The Divine Mother, Benevolent and Longevous, Kind and Good Immortal Consort.

Her mother’s toil must never be forgotten,
How vast is Earth’s virtue, boundless in harmony.
Forever adhering to her mother’s teachings, transmitting the household’s prosperity,
She chants the four chapters of “Thinking of Equality.”
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Aid, in the Hall of Harmonious Kinship,
Ocarina and flute play in alternation, their wings mutually completing,
Possessing both civil and martial talents, embodying the principles of brotherly and fraternal harmony,
Enfeoffed with land and titles, guarding the marches, granted the honor of increased fiefs,
Exalting virtue and repaying merit, simultaneously bestowed with royal titles,
Loving one another without resentment, ample and abundant,
Most sacred, most numinous, most fraternal, most loving,
The Divine Brothers, the Ennobled Princes in Array.

Before the Hall of Flourishing Blossoms, the village of accumulated goodness,
In former years, they were simultaneously granted royal titles,
A household of filial piety and fraternal love, their lofty integrity commended,
Their benevolent legacy endures for a thousand years in the Hall of Harmonious Kinship.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Numinous Aid, in the Hall of Joyous Feasting,
Her curtains and skirts immaculately ordered, her silk screens arrayed in solemnity,
The household reveres the wife’s honored rites, as the love of Lady Zhong was recorded in literature,
She was known for the talents of a daughter of the Xie family, renowned for her virtue,
Combining the beauty of Lady Zhong, personally upholding the Four Teachings,
Her blessings bestowed upon the common people,
Most sacred, most numinous, most yielding, most tranquil,
The Divine Brothers’ Sacred Consorts in Array.

Reverently serving her mother’s countenance, delighting in fraternal harmony,
The hall filled with harmonious qi, smiling and joyful,
Distinctions of seniority preserved in the household’s prosperity,
Even slightly improper caps are not admitted to the censer.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Numinous Aid, in the Hall of Harmonious Kinship,
Her descendants perpetuate abundance, their fragrance transmitted for a hundred generations,
Her children and grandchildren are worthy, displaying the refinement of orchids and irises,
The ancestral grand affairs rejoice in the preservation of hairpins and hairpieces,
Singing the poem of the creeping vine, chanting the virtue of the louse,
Most sacred, most numinous, most compliant, most reverent.

chunks.original_text: 神子神孙列位公侯。 清白遗风教尚存，声名高显大于门。 公侯自有公侯种，阴骘元来在子孙。 志心皈命礼，灵济殿内，亲睦堂中， 教有大伦，睦亲三族，受天之禄，食千锺以至万锺，列地而封，先同姓而后异姓，既辱刘将军弘深之爱，还知富郑公修谨之贤，名重于时，赏延于世，至圣至灵，至亲至仁神舅神婿列位公侯。 渭阳舅氏母之亲，曾知珠玉朗然明。 更为编序昌黎集，李汉文章播盛名。 志心皈命礼，灵济宫中，燕喜堂内，闺闱肃整，法度严明，为给为稀，志在女工之事，采苹采藻，教以絺德为先，礼宜奉於舅姑，孝不忘於父母，至圣至灵，至敬至顺，神女神妇列位仙妃。 七篇女戒曲相从，惟舅惟姑父母同。 佩悦苣兰如所赐，执勤妇德肃而雍。 志心皈命礼，灵济殿内，燕喜堂中，云幙逍遥，月宫富贵，其服济济，振诱衣而披桂裳，其状峨峨，缀明珠而载金翠，美矣，丽矣，温乎，烨乎。 愿泄巫山之灵，永为福地之相，至圣至灵，自由自在，合殿列位圣眷夫人。 珠履金钗满掖庭，态浓意远淑而真。 采苹于沼公侯事，不比椒房号与秦。 志心皈命礼，灵济殿内，燕喜堂中，日曜为魂，月曜为魄，太乙有监生之典，天乙有注生之司，星宿储精，感长庚而入梦，山川孕秀，喜帝岳之降神，抱来天上之麒麟，并作人间之鸾鷟，至圣至灵，随感随应。 太乙监生神后、天乙注生神后列位合属夫人。 梦吉维何喜弄璋，鳌峰秀气发祥光。 子生孙兮孙生子，本支百世炽而昌。 志心皈命礼，龙首庙庭，鳌峰圣境，职分百辟，位列九卿，司禄乃文昌之权衡，司福乃注生之主宰，训遵洪范，曰寿、曰富、曰康宁。 颂献阀宫，俾炽，俾昌，俾耆艾，人人胥庆，在在蒙恩，至圣至灵，如响如答，左右福禄列位真司主宰。 福禄双星现斗枢，职分左右进贤书。 世家积善称君子，子子孙孙庆有余。 志心皈命礼，龙首庙庭，鳌峰圣境，电光闪闪，云气高高，天何言哉，声雷霆而震怒，地之利也，资雨露以相生，神机运於不测之中，妙化斡於无形之境，恩沾九有，泽被群生，至圣至灵，则变则化，雷公电母、风伯雨师，本宫昭灵，孚济龙王，及五方社令，行雨龙神等众。 龙乘云气固能灵，声动雷霆万里惊。 天下苍生霖雨愿，顿令头角起峥嵘。 志心皈命礼，鳌峰圣境，龙首庙庭，乃圣乃神，在左在右，或献优旃之技，或精管辂之能，掌膳者，物用八珍，典乐者，声谐六律，兵十六卫，举皆出将之材，骑三百人，各有封侯之相，威灵赫赫，图像狞狞，至圣至，灵，有严有翼，合殿合属，威灵威灵。 以劳定国该施民，香火因缘配庙庭。 将相声名长在世，千年图像赞麒鳞。 举足各长跪，虔诚忏悔。 志心皈身归神皈命九天灵济真君、合殿威灵仙众。 伏望圣慈大垂巨泽，普降洪恩，以今斋恪虔诚，皈投忏悔。 伏闻祸福无门，惟人自召。 吉凶有兆，如影随形。 善者恶之符，恶者善之信。 为善者，五行扶我，司命与我。 为恶者，凶气覆之，恶星照之。 虽天网之难逃，在人心之知觉。 今辰伏念一切众生，皈心向道，至诚感神，躬礼真聪。 首陈自责，爰从曩劫，迨生今生。 耻过作非，去顺效逆。 变情询执，挟诈抵巇。 以幽阴诡侧而行其奸，以酷毒残忍而肆其害。
chunks.translated_text:
The divine sons and divine grandsons, the ranks of dukes and marquises.
The legacy of purity and integrity endures in their teachings,
Their renown resounds, their gates towering in grandeur.
Dukes and marquises bear the lineage of dukes and marquises,
For hidden merits inherently reside in their descendants.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Numinous Aid, in the Hall of Harmonious Kinship,
Their teachings uphold the great ethical principles,
Harmonizing the three branches of kinship,
Receiving Heaven’s blessings,
Feasting on a thousand measures, even ten thousand measures,
Enfeoffed upon the earth,
First among those of the same surname, then among those of different surnames,
Having humbly received the profound love of General Liu Hong,
And knowing the prudent virtue of the honorable Fu Zheng,
Their names weigh heavily in their time,
Their rewards extend through the ages,
Most sacred, most numinous, most kindred, most benevolent—the divine uncles and divine sons-in-law, the ranks of dukes and marquises.

The maternal uncle of Weiyang, kin to the mother,
Once knew the brilliance of pearls and jade.
Further compiling the works of Han Yu in order,
Li Han’s literary fame spread far and wide.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Numinous Aid, in the Hall of Swallowing Joy,
The inner chambers are solemn and orderly,
The laws and disciplines strictly observed,
Whether abundant or scarce,
Their aspirations lie in women’s work,
Gathering duckweed and pondweed,
Teaching that refined virtue comes first,
Rites dictate devotion to parents-in-law,
Filial piety never forgets one’s own parents,
Most sacred, most numinous, most reverent, most compliant—the divine daughters and divine daughters-in-law, the ranks of immortal consorts.

The seven chapters of the *Nü Jie* follow in harmony,
Whether to uncles or parents-in-law, they are as to parents.
Delighted to wear the gifts of orchids and mallows,
They diligently uphold the virtue of wives, solemn and harmonious.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Numinous Aid, in the Hall of Swallowing Joy,
Beneath cloud-canopied pavilions, they wander freely,
In the Moon Palace, they enjoy wealth and nobility,
Their robes flow gracefully,
Adorning themselves with trailing garments and osmanthus skirts,
Their forms towering,
Adorned with bright pearls and golden kingfisher plumes,
How beautiful, how radiant,
Gentle and resplendent.
May they channel the numinous power of Mount Wu,
Forever serving as the auspicious omens of this blessed land,
Most sacred, most numinous, free and unbound—the assembled ranks of sacred consorts within the hall.

Pearl-slippered and golden-haired, they fill the palace courtyards,
Their demeanor rich, their intentions profound, refined and true.
Gathering duckweed from the ponds, as befits the affairs of dukes and marquises,
Unlike the imperial consort’s chambers, famed as those of the Qin.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
Within the Hall of Numinous Aid, in the Hall of Swallowing Joy,
The sun as their soul, the moon as their spirit,
The Great Unity oversees the register of births,
The Heavenly Unity governs the office of life-bestowing,
The constellations store essence,
Inspiring dreams through the Evening Star,
Mountains and rivers nurture brilliance,
Rejoicing in the descent of the sacred peaks,
Embracing the qilin from Heaven above,
Becoming the phoenixes of the human realm,
Most sacred, most numinous, responsive to every invocation.

The Divine Overseers of the Great Unity’s Birth Register,
The Divine Overseers of the Heavenly Unity’s Life-Bestowing Office,
The assembled ranks of consorts.
What joy in auspicious dreams—playing with jade scepters,
The auspicious qi of Mount Ao shines forth.
Children beget grandchildren, grandchildren beget children,
A hundred generations of the main branch flourish and prosper.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
In the courtyard of the Dragon’s Head Temple, in the sacred realm of Mount Ao,
Their duties encompass the hundred officials,
Their ranks among the nine ministers,
The Controller of Emoluments wields the scales of Wenchang,
The Master of Blessings governs the life-bestowing authority,
Their teachings follow the *Hong Fan*:
"Long life, wealth, health, and peace."
Their praises resound in the ancestral temple,
Bringing prosperity, flourishing, and longevity,
Each person rejoices,
Everywhere receives grace,
Most sacred, most numinous, echoing like response to sound—the divine overseers of left and right blessings and emoluments.

The twin stars of Blessing and Emolument appear at the pivot of the Dipper,
Their duties lie in advancing the worthy through the imperial examinations.
Esteemed families, accumulating goodness, are called gentlemen,
Their children and grandchildren overflow with blessings.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
In the courtyard of the Dragon’s Head Temple, in the sacred realm of Mount Ao,
Lightning flashes brilliantly,
Clouds rise high,
Heaven speaks not, yet its voice thunders in wrath,
The earth’s bounty relies on rain and dew to nurture life,
Divine mechanisms operate in the unfathomable,
Wondrous transformations turn in the formless,
Grace extends to the nine regions,
Blessings cover all living beings,
Most sacred, most numinous, ever-changing, ever-transforming—
Lord Thunder and Mother Lightning,
Earl Wind and Master Rain,
The luminous spirits of this palace,
The trustworthy Dragon Kings of Aid,
And the local earth deities of the five directions,
The rain-bringing dragon spirits, and all others.

Dragons ride the clouds, inherently numinous,
Their voices shake the thunder for ten thousand miles.
The world’s multitudes yearn for timely rain,
Suddenly their horns rise, towering and majestic.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and take refuge, honoring:
In the sacred realm of Mount Ao, in the courtyard of the Dragon’s Head Temple,
Most sacred, most divine,
To the left, to the right,
Some present the arts of jesters,
Others excel in the skills of charioteers,
The stewards of the kitchen employ the eight delicacies,
The masters of music harmonize the six pitches,
The sixteen guards of the army are all generals in the making,
The three hundred cavalrymen each bear the marks of marquises,
Their might and numinosity resplendent,
Their images fierce and awe-inspiring,
Most sacred, most numinous, stern and protective,
The assembled ranks of the hall, the assembled ranks of the hall,
Mighty and numinous, mighty and numinous.

For their labors in stabilizing the state and benefiting the people,
Their incense and karmic ties are enshrined in the temple.
The fame of generals and ministers endures through the ages,
Their images praised for a thousand years like the qilin.
We kneel in reverence,
Sincerely repenting.
With devoted hearts, we surrender our bodies and take refuge,
Prostrating before the Nine Heavens’ Numinous Aid Perfected Lord,
And the assembled might and numinous immortals of the hall.

We humbly beseech the sacred compassion to bestow great blessings,
Showering vast grace,
As today, with solemn devotion,
We prostrate in repentance.
We have heard that misfortune and fortune have no fixed gate,
Only summoned by one’s own actions.
Good and ill omens appear,
Like shadows following form.
Goodness is the tally of evil,
Evil is the proof of goodness.
For those who do good,
The five phases support them,
The Controller of Fate befriends them.
For those who do evil,
Malevolent qi overwhelms them,
Evil stars shine upon them.
Though the Heavenly Net is inescapable,
It lies in the awakening of the human heart.
Today, we reflect upon all sentient beings,
Turning their hearts toward the Dao,
Sincerely invoking the divine,
Bowing in reverence to the truly wise.
First confessing our faults,
From past kalpas to this present life,
We have been ashamed of our transgressions, committing wrongs,
Turning from compliance to rebellion,
Altering our nature, clinging to obstinacy,
Employing deceit to exploit fissures,
Acting with dark cunning and perversity to carry out treachery,
Exercising cruelty and savagery to inflict harm.

chunks.original_text: 颠倒梦想，昏迷乎利名。 志之场杀盗邪淫，沈汩於贪嗔痴之境。 大则欺於天地，幽则负於神明。 怒暑怨寒，呵风骂雨。 或对星辰而便利，或对日月而裸程。 或指虹霓，或盟山海。 破坏庙社，触秽道场。 不知身心口意之非，不安士农工贾之分。 不崇三宝，不习五常。 为人谋而不忠，与朋交而不信，事亲非孝，背主忘恩。 为富不仁，重财不义。 谓祭无益，谓暴无伤。 谓敬不足行，谓言不足畏。 犯上作乱，好勇疾贫。 斥陷忠良，侵陵孤弱。 欺公灭私，薄人厚己，教唆词讼，结构冤雠。 侮慢自无徽虐，自作不明乎善，不诚乎身。 小弁作，而或父子之恩亏，棠棣废，而或兄弟之情缺。 国俗败而兴谷风之刺。 骨肉怨。 而歌角弓之诗。 既知罪恶之贯盈，恭对慈悲悲而忏悔。 人谁无过，过而能改，每怀战战栗栗之忧。 神无常享，享於克诚。 小致切切拳拳之悃。 伏愿至仁孚佑，大道垂怜。 赦其已往之愆，锡以方来之祉。 群方胥庆，率土蒙恩。 当今之日太平，灾不生，祸不作，诸福之物毕至。 老者壮，少者强，久钦灵德之威光，用作济民之事业。 某等至心稽首再拜，礼谢 灵济二位真君。 举。 弟子一心稽首，礼谢 九天金阙洪恩真君。 弟子一心稽首，礼谢 九天玉阙洪恩真君。 弟子一心稽首，礼谢 圣父忠武翊亮真君。 披陈素愿，伏愿圣慈俯赐鉴临。 一愿当今皇帝寿，和：寿与天齐万万春。 二愿臣僚资禄位，和：风云千载庆嘉亨。 三愿儒冠多富贵，和：名登天府作公卿。 四愿农民勤稼穑，和：自今岁岁喜三登。 五愿百工精技艺，和：待诏斑门听玉音。 六愿生财有大道，和：千户封君可比伦。 七愿风调并雨顺，和：普天率土贺升平。 八愿香火常隆盛，和：千年庙貌显威灵。 九愿九天加锡命，和：玉佩跄趋拜紫宸。 十愿十方诸信善，和：皈依三宝各虔诚。 上来立礼赞文，公德已周。 道场众等人，各虔诚再伸启白：伏闻兢兢业业，自惭重渎之再三。 赫赫明明，恭观威颜之咫尺。 铭心知感，稽首扬言。 德之着者，曰显灵昭灵。 功可推，而为溥济博济。 津梁众苦，日月群迷。 今辰修设醉恩祈福道场，臣等恭对真聪，宣扬妙范。 少伸三沐三熏之敬，莫殚一瞻一礼之恭。 神听无私，情由可鉴。 用涤曩劫今生之罪业，愿作见在未来之果因。 有始有终，无恶无歜。 知可及，愚不可及。 神化之，民使宜之。 行满功圆，可以进於玉室丹台之上。 气存神正，可以开於紫阳云锦之囊。 信男信女，咸得长生。 亿曾万祖，皆即受度。 遍及幽冥之异类，尽归缥缈之大乘。 为上因缘，念，举，天尊号。 真君愿科毕 玑衡七政星灯科 以今焚香，供养 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君、 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君、 宫中神仙、诸灵官，普同供养。 恭闻龙汉开图，而玄元始之炁分。 鳌极物化，而天地人之位定。 夫人也，大道难遇，中土难生。 况抱以阳，负以阴，四肢既立。 必贵其形，保其命，万炁长存。 惟恐老死病。 若之为忧，各以长大美好而自悦。 人有所欲，天无私亲。 何赐也富，何宪也贫，何彭之寿，何颜之夭。 母诱之数，盍求诸身。 尔时灵济真君，游宴玉清圣境，熙帝之载，则天之明。
chunks.translated_text:
Deluded by dreams and illusions, they wander lost in the pursuit of profit and fame.
Their wills are ensnared in the fields of killing, theft, deceit, and lust,
Sunk deep in the realms of greed, hatred, and delusion.
In great matters, they deceive Heaven and Earth;
In hidden ways, they betray the gods and spirits.
They curse the scorching heat and resent the cold,
Rebuke the wind and revile the rain.
At times, they relieve themselves beneath the stars,
Or expose themselves naked before the sun and moon.
They point at rainbows, swear oaths by mountains and seas,
Desecrate temples and shrines, defile sacred precincts.
Unmindful of the transgressions of body, heart, speech, and intent,
They disregard the proper roles of scholar, farmer, artisan, and merchant.
They neither honor the Three Treasures nor cultivate the Five Constants.
In serving others, they are disloyal;
In friendship, they are untrustworthy.
Toward parents, they are unfilial;
Toward lords, they are ungrateful.
The wealthy lack benevolence;
Those who hoard wealth lack righteousness.
They claim sacrifices are futile,
That violence causes no harm,
That reverence is not worth practicing,
That words are not to be feared.
They rebel against superiors and stir up chaos,
Flaunt their strength and resent poverty.
They slander and entrap the loyal and good,
Bully the orphaned and weak.
They suppress the public for private gain,
Exalt themselves while belittling others,
Incite lawsuits and sow enmity.
They mock and humiliate the innocent,
Act in ignorance of goodness,
And lack sincerity in themselves.
Minor transgressions may sever the bond between father and son,
Or dissolve the affection between brothers.
When the customs of the state decay, the lament of *Gufeng* arises;
When kin turn against one another, the song of *Jiaogong* is sung.
Now, recognizing the full measure of their sins,
They bow in reverence before the compassionate and repent in sorrow.
Who among men is without fault?
Yet if one errs and then reforms,
One should ever tremble with fear.
The gods do not accept offerings unconditionally,
But only those made with utmost sincerity.
With humble and earnest devotion,
They prostrate themselves, praying that the Most Benevolent may grant protection,
That the Great Dao may show mercy,
Forgiving past transgressions
And bestowing future blessings.
May all regions rejoice,
And all lands receive grace.
May this day bring great peace,
With no disasters arising, no calamities befalling,
And all things of fortune arriving in full.
May the old grow strong,
The young grow vigorous,
And the awe-inspiring virtue of the divine spirits be long revered,
So that their works may aid the people.
With utmost sincerity, we bow twice in worship and give thanks
To the Two True Lords of Lingji.
*Rise.*
Disciples, with one heart, bow in worship and give thanks
To the True Lord of Vast Grace of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Portal.
Disciples, with one heart, bow in worship and give thanks
To the True Lord of Vast Grace of the Nine Heavens’ Jade Portal.
Disciples, with one heart, bow in worship and give thanks
To the Sacred Father, True Lord of Loyalty and Martial Brilliance.
Having laid bare our earnest wishes, we humbly pray that the Sacred Compassion may deign to look upon us.

We offer ten prayers:
First, may the present Emperor’s longevity be as boundless as Heaven, harmonizing thus:
*May his years match Heaven’s, ten thousand springs in endless bliss.*
Second, may the ministers and officials enjoy rank and emolument, harmonizing thus:
*May wind and cloud bring a thousand years of joyous prosperity.*
Third, may the scholars attain wealth and nobility, harmonizing thus:
*May their names ascend to Heaven’s court as dukes and ministers.*
Fourth, may the farmers diligently till the soil, harmonizing thus:
*From this year onward, may each harvest bring triple abundance.*
Fifth, may the artisans perfect their crafts, harmonizing thus:
*May they await the imperial summons at the palace gates, hearing the jade tones of decree.*
Sixth, may the path to wealth be broad and true, harmonizing thus:
*May a thousand households be enfeoffed as lords, their ranks unmatched.*
Seventh, may wind and rain be timely and harmonious, harmonizing thus:
*May all under Heaven rejoice in peace and prosperity.*
Eighth, may the incense fires ever flourish, harmonizing thus:
*May the temple’s majesty and divine power endure for a thousand years.*
Ninth, may the Nine Heavens bestow their mandate, harmonizing thus:
*May jade pendants chime as they approach the Purple Throne.*
Tenth, may all faithful and good beings in the ten directions, harmonizing thus:
*Return to the Three Treasures, each with utmost devotion.*

The rites of worship and hymns of praise are now complete.
All in the Daoist assembly, with reverence, once more address the spirits:
We have heard that with trembling caution, we dare not presume upon your patience,
Yet with awe and clarity, we behold your majestic presence before us.
With hearts inscribed by gratitude, we bow and raise our voices.
The virtues that shine forth are called manifest and luminous power;
Their merits may be extended to become universal and boundless salvation.
They serve as a bridge for the suffering,
A light for the lost in darkness.
Today, in this rite of gratitude and prayer for blessings,
We humbly stand before the True and Wise,
Proclaiming the wondrous teachings.
We offer the respect of triple ablutions and triple incense,
Yet cannot exhaust the reverence of even a single glance or bow.
The gods hear without partiality,
And our sincerity is plain before them.
May they cleanse the sins of past kalpas and this present life,
And let these acts become the causes of blessings in this life and the next.
With beginning and end complete,
Without evil or blemish,
What can be grasped, the foolish may yet attain;
What lies beyond, even the wise cannot fathom.
The gods transform, and the people are rightly guided.
When merit is fulfilled and deeds perfected,
One may ascend to the Jade Chamber and Cinnabar Terrace.
With qi preserved and spirit aligned,
One may open the brocade pouch of the Purple Yang.
May all faithful men and women attain long life,
And their ancestors of a hundred thousand generations all receive deliverance.
May even the departed in the hidden realms,
And all beings of every kind,
Return to the vast and boundless Great Vehicle.
For the supreme cause, we chant the invocation of the Heavenly Worthy.
The rites for the True Lords are now complete.

The Rite of the Seven Stars of the Celestial Balance is observed.
Today, we burn incense in offering to
The Great Immortal of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Portal, Illuminator of the Dao, Attainer of Virtue, Manifest Spirit of Universal Salvation, Pure and Subtle, Void and Wondrous, Compassionate and Benevolent, Protector of the State and Shelter of the People, True Lord of Vast Grace and Exalted Blessings;
The Supreme Immortal of the Nine Heavens’ Jade Portal, Propagator of Transformation, Upholder of the Teachings, Radiant Spirit of Boundless Salvation, Lofty and Serene, Profound and Wondrous, Kind and Benevolent, Assistant to the State and Benefactor of the People, True Lord of Vast Grace and Abundant Blessings;
The Divine Immortals within the Palace,
And all the Spirit Officials—
We make offerings to all alike.

We reverently recall that when the Dragon Han unfolded the cosmic chart,
The primordial qi of the Mysterious and Original divided.
When the great turtle bore the transformations of all things,
The positions of Heaven, Earth, and Man were established.
For mankind, the Great Dao is hard to encounter,
And to be born in the Middle Land is rare.
Moreover, we are endowed with yang and yin,
Our four limbs formed.
We must value our bodies, preserve our lives,
And keep the myriad qi ever present.
Yet we fear old age, sickness, and death,
And each rejoices in growing tall and fair.
Man has desires, but Heaven shows no partiality.
Why are some granted wealth, while others suffer poverty?
Why do some live long like Pengzu, while others die young like Yanling?
The numbers of fate’s allotment—why not seek them within ourselves?

At that time, the True Lords of Lingji were roaming and feasting in the Jade Pure Sacred Realm,
In the radiant reign of the August Emperor,
Under the luminous gaze of Heaven.

The two luminaries I traverse—one summer, one winter—follow their ordered sequence.

Only utmost sincerity can move the spirits, and thus the accumulation of good deeds must yield abundant blessings.
Bathed in the radiance of their illumination, how dare we forget the debt of gratitude we owe?

He elucidates the sacred canons and kindles the divine lamps.
Gazing upward at the warp and weft of the celestial texts, he envisions afar the forms of the armillary sphere.
The orchid incense burns bright—its blaze is seen, its embers unseen.
The iron vessel holds its oil—its increase is seen, its decrease unseen.
Above, it illumines the thirty-two heavens, its brilliance vast and boundless.
Below, it enables the multitudes of hundreds and thousands to behold, revere, and take refuge.

chunks.original_text: 众善自光中生，众恶自光中灭。 一作礼而再作礼，心眼玲珑。 初上香至三上香，歌声响亮。 仰惟洞鉴，俯赐恩光。 更冀三界齐临，万人恭诣。 凶星退舍，在四时则无害无灾。 吉曜临轩，锡五福以曰福曰寿。 稽首皈依至真妙道德光常曜天尊。 法众等志心皈命灵济宫 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵普济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君， 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君， 宫中神仙、诸灵官。 谨燃玑衡七政神灯，上布日曜太阳之象。 恭闻道在太极之始，莫见乎亿，莫显乎微。 日者众阳所宗，无愿不成，无幽不察。 莫测其妙，所存者神。 赫赫厥灵，人可畏之如赵盾。 明明在上，民皆仰之若周公。 辉光其德，盛矣乎。 洁白其节，皎如也。 乌轮肃备，朝觐萦仪之宫。 羲驾庄严。 燕享洞阳之殿。 放出毫光万丈，普照世界三千。 入吾门也，无那屋之疑。 遵吾道也，灭索涂之病。 伏念一切众生，尘埃汩没，徒穷遂影之劳。 雹露虚华，惟有过隙之叹。 自今反照，与道常明。 伏愿中为市者，获行商坐贾之财。 出而作之，安耕曰凿井之业。 艺之巧者，以圭测影。 工之勤者，继晷焚膏。 为儒者，赋夸五色文章。 入仕者，名号砖八学士。 桑榆残照，争同松栢以长青。 萤躏增辉，愿与昆虫而被泽。 少竭葵倾之敬，愿垂藻景之光。 请法众谨依太上所说太阳帝君神咒，稽首皈依，虔诚赞咏。 志心皈命信礼 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君。 志心皈命信礼 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君。 咒捻午文，吸午气。 遥想洞阳郁仪宫真君如在。 东望扶桑宫，稽首朝郁仪。 太阳洞明景，寥寥何所思。 令我拜金色，候天想英姿。 皇华将玉女，临轩降此时。 和：愿此灯光，回向真君。 散花。 大明圆极天尊。 法众等志心皈命灵济宫 九天金阙明道达德大仙显灵溥济清微洞玄冲虚妙感慈惠护国庇民崇福洪恩真君、 九天玉阙宣化扶教上仙昭灵博济高明弘静冲湛妙应仁惠辅国佑民隆福洪恩真君、 宫中神仙、诸灵官。 谨燃玑衡七政神灯，上布月曜太阴之象。 恭闻袒气在太空之中，无色无绪。 月魄泛下华之采，有性有情。 经於箕而起风，离於毕而作雨。 天之工也。 神而明之。

All good arises from within the light, all evil perishes within the light.
Bowing once and bowing again, the heart’s eye becomes clear and bright.
From the first offering of incense to the third, the chanting voices ring clear.
Gazing upward, we trust in your all-seeing gaze; looking down, we beseech your radiant grace.
May the Three Realms descend as one, and ten thousand people come in reverence.
Malevolent stars retreat and withdraw—throughout the four seasons, no harm nor calamity shall arise.
Auspicious luminaries approach the hall, bestowing the Five Blessings: fortune and longevity.
We bow our heads in homage, taking refuge in the ever-radiant Perfected Wondrous Dao and Virtue, the Heavenly Worthy of Constant Illumination.

The assembly, with sincere devotion, takes refuge and pledges faith to the Sacred Palace of Lingji:
The Heavenly Golden Portal’s Illuminated Dao and Attained Virtue Great Immortal, Manifestly Revealed and Universally Salvific, Pure Subtle Cavernous Mystery, Void and Wondrously Responsive, Compassionate and Benevolent Protector of the Nation and Shelter of the People, Exalted Blessing and Vast Grace Perfected Lord;
The Heavenly Jade Portal’s Proclaimed Transformation and Upholding Teaching Supreme Immortal, Illustrious and Vastly Salvific, Lofty and Illuminated, Vast and Serene, Void and Profound, Wondrously Responsive, Benevolent and Compassionate Assistant to the Nation and Protector of the People, Abundant Blessing and Vast Grace Perfected Lord;
The immortals within the palace, and all the numinous officials.

We reverently kindle the Seven Luminaries’ Divine Lamps of the Armillary Sphere, arranging above the image of the sun’s radiant yang.
We humbly recall: the Dao resides in the beginning of the Great Ultimate—unseen in its boundlessness, unmanifest in its subtlety.
The sun is the essence of all yang, fulfilling every aspiration and illuminating every hidden realm.
Its mystery is unfathomable, its presence divine.
Resplendent is its numinous power—men revere it as they did Zhao Dun.
Brilliant and ever-present above, the people gaze upon it as they did the Duke of Zhou.
Its virtue shines with radiance, vast indeed.
Its purity gleams like jade, bright and clear.
The crow-wheel is solemnly prepared, circling the palace of entangled ritual.
The chariot of Xi is majestically adorned, offering homage in the Hall of Cavernous Yang.
It emits a thousand-yard radiance, universally illuminating the three-thousandfold world.
Entering our gate, it dispels the doubt of the homeless.
Following our Dao, it eradicates the ailments of the forsaken path.

We reflect upon all sentient beings, lost in the dust and drowned in obscurity, vainly exhausting themselves in pursuit of shadows.
Like hail and dew, their splendor is fleeting—only the lament of passing moments remains.
From this day forth, may they turn inward and reflect, abiding in the Dao’s constant illumination.

We pray that those who trade in the marketplace may gain the wealth of merchants and shopkeepers.
Those who labor in the fields may find peace in plowing and well-digging.
The skilled artisan may measure shadows with the jade tablet.
The diligent craftsman may burn the midnight oil.
The scholar may compose verses in five-colored splendor.
The official may earn the title of the Eight Learned Scholars.
In the twilight of their years, may they vie with the pine and cypress in evergreen vitality.
May the glow of the firefly’s light increase, and may they share in the blessings bestowed upon all creatures.

With hearts as devoted as the sunflower’s turning, we beseech the bestowal of your radiant light.
The assembly now reverently follows the incantation of the Sun Sovereign as spoken by the Most High, bowing in homage and chanting with devotion.

With sincere hearts, we take refuge and pledge faith:
To the Heavenly Golden Portal’s Illuminated Dao and Attained Virtue Great Immortal, Manifestly Revealed and Universally Salvific, Pure Subtle Cavernous Mystery, Void and Wondrously Responsive, Compassionate and Benevolent Protector of the Nation and Shelter of the People, Exalted Blessing and Vast Grace Perfected Lord.
To the Heavenly Jade Portal’s Proclaimed Transformation and Upholding Teaching Supreme Immortal, Illustrious and Vastly Salvific, Lofty and Illuminated, Vast and Serene, Void and Profound, Wondrously Responsive, Benevolent and Compassionate Assistant to the Nation and Protector of the People, Abundant Blessing and Vast Grace Perfected Lord.

Forming the noon mudra, we inhale the noon qi.
From afar, we envision the Perfected Lord of the Cavernous Yang’s Resplendent Palace as if present.
Gazing eastward toward the Fusang Palace, we bow in homage to the Resplendent One.
O radiant light of the Cavernous Sun, vast and boundless—what thoughts arise?
Grant me the golden hue, awaiting the celestial vision of your majestic form.
The imperial blossoms and jade maidens descend to the hall at this very hour.

*Response:* May this lamp’s light be directed toward the Perfected Lord.
Scatter flowers.
The Heavenly Worthy of Great Illumination and Perfect Extremity.
